channel.title: Stochastic Oscillator on Roman Kurnovskii
channel.description: Recent content in Stochastic Oscillator on Roman Kurnovskii

item.title: Stochastic Oscillator - Momentum Indicator
item.description: About The Stochastic Oscillator is a momentum indicator that shows the location of the close relative to the high-low range over a set number of periods. It was developed by George Lane in the 1950s. Calculating Formula The Stochastic Oscillator is calculated using the following formula: %K = 100[(C - L14) / (H14 - L14)] where: C = the most recent closing price L14 = the lowest price traded of the 14 previous trading sessions H14 = the highest price traded during the same 14-day period %K = the current value of the stochastic indicator The “%D” line is then a 3-day simple moving average of %K.
